content.question: <math alttext="100"><mn>100</mn></math> liters of water and <math alttext="5"><mn>5</mn></math> kilograms of sugar were added to an empty mixing tank to make sugar water. Starting at time <math alttext="t equals 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> minutes, additional water is added to the tank at a rate of <math alttext="10"><mn>10</mn></math> liters per minute, and additional sugar is added to the tank at a rate of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> kilograms per minute. Which of the following gives an expression for <math alttext="C open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>C</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math>, the concentration of sugar water, in kilograms per liter, in the tank at time <math alttext="t greater or equal than 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></math> minutes?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="fraction numerator 5 plus 2 t over denominator 100 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mn>100</mn></mfrac></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator 5 plus 2 t over denominator 100 plus 10 t end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="fraction numerator 5 plus 2 t over denominator 100 plus 10 t end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
